name: Way of the Drunken Master
description: Monks of the Way of the Drunken Master emulate the unpredictable movements of a drunkard. They sway and stagger in battle, masking a precise and skillful fighting style. They use their erratic movements to confuse opponents, making them difficult to engage while effectively executing a dance of offense and defense.

bonus_proficiencies.description: You gain proficiency in the Performance skill and with brewer's supplies if you don't already have them.

drunken_technique.description: When you use Flurry of Blows, you benefit from the Disengage action, and your walking speed increases by 10 feet until the end of the turn.

tipsy_sway.description:
You gain the following benefits:
- **Leap to Your Feet**: Stand up from being prone by spending 5 feet of movement instead of half your speed.
- **Redirect Attack**: Spend 1 ki point as a reaction to cause a missed melee attack against you to hit a creature of your choice within 5 feet of you, other than the attacker.

drunkards_luck.description: When you have disadvantage on an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, you can spend 2 ki points to cancel the disadvantage for that roll.

intoxicated_frenzy.description: When you use Flurry of Blows, you can make up to three additional attacks (for a total of up to five Flurry of Blows attacks) provided that each attack targets a different creature this turn.
